description:
Heimdall is a cross-platform open-source tool suite used to flash firmware (aka ROMs) onto Samsung mobile devices.
			Heimdall connects to a mobile device over USB and interact with software running on device known as Loke.
			Loke and Heimdall communicate via the custom Samsung-developed protocol sometimes referred to as the 'Odin protocol'.
summary: Heimdall is a cross-platform open-source tool suite used to flash firmware (aka ROMs) onto Samsung mobile devices.
author: Glass Echidna
